resources.string: Users can navigate and interact with their Android device using a physical keyboard, rather than touching the screen. Your app should allow keyboard users to perform all the actions that are possible using touch.

When navigating with a keyboard, all interactable elements should be focusable. Note, this is different to navigating with a screen reader, which should also focus for example on text elements in order to read them out.
How to test your app using a keyboard to navigate?

With your app running in an emulator in Android Studio you can simply press the tab key to move focus to the next element. Press enter to interact with the currently focused element. You can also navigate the screen using the arrow keys.
By default, a button is shown to be in focus by a slight change in colour:
Here a border makes it clearer which element is in focus:
Here a higher contrast color change makes it clearer which element is in focus:
Here the focus order is specified to be different from the default:
Select this option as your favourite?
